title: AI craze leaves only one Nvidia RTX 50-series GPU at MSRP RTX 5060 Ti 8GB makes the final stand, as even the RTX 5050 falls
summary: The Nvidia RTX 50-series is experiencing stock shortages, with only the RTX 5060 Ti 8GB variants from MSI and Gigabyte remaining at their MSRP. The RTX 5050 has fallen out of stock, and other variants are experiencing price increases. This scarcity is affecting the availability of Nvidia's latest graphics cards.
insight: Nvidia RTX 50-series shortages drive up prices for remaining options

title: The great Bench GPU retest begins how we're testing for our GPU Hierarchy in 2026, and why upscaling and framegen are still out
summary: We're updating our GPU hierarchy and bench database for 2026, focusing on performance in various games without relying on upscaling or frame generation techniques. Our test suite includes a mix of new and classic titles, ensuring a comprehensive assessment of modern GPUs. This process aims to provide a more accurate representation of GPU capabilities.
insight: Accurate GPU performance evaluation requires real-time rendering, not upscaling or framegen.

title: U.S. Supreme Court shoots down President Trump s tariffs Consumer Technology Association hails 'victory for all Americans,' calls for swift refunds to retailers (update)
summary: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled against President Trump's tariffs, stating the IEEPA doesn't grant authority to impose tariffs on imports. This decision restricts the White House's power to regulate imports through tariffs.
insight: IEEPA limits presidential authority over tariffs on imports.

title: Microsoft's Project Silica write-once storage could store terabytes of data for over 10,000 years company explores two physical glass storage methods, so the glass-clad future of storage isn't coming anytime soon
summary: Microsoft's Project Silica explores glass storage, but commercialization is still distant.
insight: Long-term data preservation through indestructible glass storage is a significant breakthrough.

title: Thermal Grizzly pops the top on Ryzen 7 9850X3Ds for you, charges eyewatering premium for delidded chips almost double the cost of a regular model, comes with its own warranty
summary: Thermal Grizzly offers delidded Ryzen 7 9850X3D chips with a 24-month warranty.
insight: Delidded chips come with warranty, addressing thermal performance concerns.

title: AWS outages caused by AI coding bot blunder, report claims
summary: Amazon experienced small outages due to AI coding bot mishaps, company cites user error as cause.
insight: AI autonomy requires robust permission controls to prevent unintended system impact.

title: OpenAI's Sam Altman warns that firms are using 'AI washing' to mask layoffs across the globe AI boss calls out corporate excuses while warning of 'palpable' job disruption ahead
summary: OpenAI's Sam Altman warns that AI is being misused to cover up layoffs. He believes the technology is used as an excuse for unrelated job cuts. Altman also predicts a significant job disruption in the near future due to AI advancements.
insight: Misuse of AI to mask job losses may delay necessary reforms.

title: Zuckerberg cuts Meta employee bonuses by 5%, follows 10% reduction last year, despite AI splurge $130 billion capex vision and eye-watering AI pay packages force efficiency elsewhere in the business
summary: Meta cuts employee bonuses by 5%, following a 10% reduction last year. This move comes despite significant investments in AI and large pay packages. The company aims to improve efficiency across its business.
insight: Meta prioritizes cost-cutting over employee rewards in AI-driven era.

title: Samsung Galaxy Book6 Ultra review: Premium creator pick
summary: The Samsung Galaxy Book6 Ultra offers a premium design and top-notch performance, but at a high cost.
insight: Premium design meets top-notch performance, but at a high price.

title: $20 million lost in 'jackpotting' ATM malware attacks in 2025, FBI reports scheme forces machines to spit out cash, targets banks and ATM operators
summary: The FBI reports a surge in ATM 'jackpotting' malware attacks in 2025, resulting in $20 million in losses. These incidents force ATMs to dispense cash, targeting banks and ATM operators. The scheme has seen a significant increase in 2025.
insight: Massive financial losses due to sophisticated ATM cyber attacks.

title: UALink roadmap plots course to optimized AI data center interconnects examining the open standard designed to combat vendor lock-in while offering cost and performance optimization
summary: UALink aims to combat vendor lock-in with an open standard for AI data center interconnects, offering cost and performance optimization. Although it has broad industry support, its adoption may be hindered by missing features. The standard's adoption would have far-reaching implications for the data center infrastructure.
insight: Breaking vendor lock-in unlocks data center infrastructure innovation

title: PC novice hits the jackpot with free RTX 3090 PC from kindly neighbour potent build features $1,500 GPU paired with liquid-cooled i9-10850K and Asus Maximus motherboard
summary: A PC novice received a free, high-end gaming PC from a generous neighbor, featuring an RTX 3090, i9-10850K, and Asus Maximus motherboard. The build showcases potent hardware, including a $1,500 GPU paired with liquid-cooling. The PC is a great first gaming machine.
insight: Free high-end gaming PC can change novice gamers' entire experience trajectory

title: This iBuyPower gaming PC with a 7800X3D and RTX 5070 Ti is an absolute steal for just $1,999 right now huge $450 saving on this 4K-capable rig with 32GB of DDR5 RAM and a 1TB SSD
summary: This iBuyPower gaming PC offers a powerful AMD Ryzen 7 7800X3D CPU, Nvidia GeForce RTX 5070 Ti GPU, 32GB of DDR5 RAM, and a 1TB SSD for $1,999.99.
insight: Significant $450 saving on a 4K-capable gaming PC with impressive specs.

title: Corsair's new "Vault" series FRAME 4000D cases have color-shifting paintjobs Priced at $140, these limited-edition towers also feature upgraded front panel I/O
summary: Corsair's new 'Vault' series FRAME 4000D cases offer color-shifting paintjobs and upgraded features at $140.
insight: Limited-edition cases merge style and function at an affordable price point.

title: 30 years later, the iconic 'Bliss' green hill from Windows XP is still thriving lucky passerby captures the hill looking almost identical to the 1996 photograph in 'super rare' event
summary: A Redditor captured a 'Bliss' hill in Napa Valley looking almost identical to the 1996 Windows XP wallpaper, a rare sight in an area now covered in vineyards.
insight: Unspoiled natural beauty can still be found in unexpected places.

title: The state of China's decade-long semiconductor push: still a decade behind, despite hundreds of billions spent and significant progress examining the original 'Made in China 2025' initiative
summary: China's decade-long semiconductor push has spent hundreds of billions, yet still lags significantly behind the US and Taiwan.
insight: China's supply chain still decades behind due to lack of core innovation.

title: After 17 years, Minecraft Java Edition starts replacing OpenGL with a Vulkan multi-threaded renderer update will prove a boon for performance and modding
summary: Minecraft Java Edition is replacing its aging OpenGL renderer with a Vulkan multi-threaded renderer, which will significantly improve performance and open up new modding opportunities.
insight: Improved performance and modding capabilities with modern Vulkan technology.

title: 2.1-channel audio HAT for Raspberry Pi features Texas Instruments TAS5825M class-D amplifier
summary: The Louder Raspberry Hat Plus features a 53W TAS5825M amplifier, offering improved efficiency and thermal performance. It supports 2.1-channel audio with DSP features, including 15-band parametric EQ and 128-tap FIR filtering. The board is compatible with all Raspberry Pi models and comes in 1X and 2X variants.
insight: Raspberry Pi gains powerful 2.1-channel audio capabilities for media centers.

title: Why the Majority of AI-Powered IoT Projects Fail: Jack Gold
summary: 75% of AI-powered IoT pilot projects fail to reach production due to technical, business, and strategic challenges. This failure rate hinders innovation and adoption of IoT technology. As a result, businesses struggle to reap the benefits of AI-powered IoT.
insight: Lack of clear IoT business value hinders AI adoption.

title: Tesla's "cheaper" Cybertruck arrives at $59,990, still far from the $40K promise
summary: Tesla's Cybertruck arrives at $59,990 with features like adaptive damping and Powershare capability.
insight: Tesla's Cybertruck fails to meet $40K price promise despite feature upgrades.

title: Fake faces generated by AI are now "too good to be true," researchers warn
summary: Think you can quickly identify fake faces generated by AI models? Think again. According to a recently published study by Australian researchers, AI-generated faces are now essentially too difficult to spot except for a small minority of people who are exceptionally skilled at analyzing facial features. As a result,... Read Entire Article

title: Real-world data shows plug-in hybrids use far more fuel than advertised
summary: Plug-in hybrids consume significantly more fuel than advertised, according to research data. Researchers studied over one million vehicles produced between 2021 and 2023. Actual fuel consumption averaged three times the certified figures.
insight: Fuel efficiency discrepancies have significant environmental and financial implications.

title: AI-powered defenses help Google shield Android users from malicious apps
summary: Google's AI-powered defenses rejected over 1.75 million malicious apps and blocked 80,000 developer accounts, a significant decrease from 2024's numbers.
insight: Improved AI-powered defenses enhance user safety and trust in the Android ecosystem.

title: Low-noise microwave amplifiers bring quantum computers closer to scale
summary: Low-noise microwave amplifiers are crucial in superconducting quantum architectures to minimize noise. Energy losses in dielectric materials have been a primary source of excess noise. This excess noise can overwhelm a qubit's delicate state during amplification.
insight: Excess noise in amplification can overwhelm qubit's delicate state.

title: Razer unveils $500 Huntsman Signature keyboard with CNC aluminum and mirror finish
summary: Razer unveils a limited-edition, $500 Huntsman Signature keyboard with a mirror finish.
insight: Luxury gaming keyboard appeals to high-end enthusiasts and collectors.

title: Amazon says AWS AI tools were involved in two outages, but calls it "coincidence"
summary: Amazon's AWS AI tools were involved in two outages, with one caused by an internal AI assistant making changes without human intervention.
insight: AI system autonomy raises concerns about human oversight and error accountability.

title: Astronomers identify a galaxy made almost entirely of dark matter
summary: Astronomers led by David Li discovered Candidate Dark Galaxy-2, a potential dark galaxy, as part of a list of ten such celestial structures. These galaxies are characterized by extremely faint starlight, making them difficult to detect. CDG-2 may be composed primarily of dark matter.
insight: Potential discovery of dark galaxies redefines our understanding of cosmic composition.

title: Tesla says its US-based robotaxi support is better than Waymo's Philippines team
summary: Tesla claims its US-based robotaxi support surpasses Waymo's team, which includes contractors from the Philippines.
insight: Geographic location affects robotaxi development and safety priorities significantly

title: How a 16-year-old intern helped Netgear shut down a global scam network
summary: A 16-year-old intern helped Netgear shut down a global scam network by making contact with the scammers. The intern's unconventional assignment led to a successful outcome. The case highlights the potential of non-traditional approaches to solving complex problems.
insight: Teenagers can bring fresh, innovative approaches to complex cybersecurity issues.

title: SignalRGB update improves UI and adds support for dozens of new devices
summary: SignalRGB has updated its app with a polished UI and expanded support for new devices, fixing bugs and enhancing user experience.
insight: Simplified RGB lighting management for PC users is now more comprehensive.

title: Google Maps is hiding reviews, photos, and more unless you sign in
summary: Google Maps is now restricting access to reviews, photos, and more for users without a Google account, displaying a limited view mode.
insight: Limited view mode affects users' ability to make informed decisions

title: Former Google engineers charged with stealing Tensor chip trade secrets
summary: Three Iranian nationals, former Google engineers, charged with stealing trade secrets related to the Tensor chip.
insight: High-stakes theft of AI chip technology poses significant national security risks.

title: AMD Zen 6 desktop CPUs may deliver 24 cores, 7 GHz targets, and AM5 support
summary: AMD's Zen 6 desktop CPUs may offer up to 24 cores and 7 GHz speeds, with a rumored Ryzen 10000 series lineup. Four single-CCD processor variants and three dual-CCD designs are expected. AM5 support may also be included.
insight: Significant performance boost for content creators and heavy users.
